instNote: ﻿The foundation of a new brick church as been laid in Sullivan's Island, near Fort Moultrie, opposite Charleston, by the efforts of Very Rev. T. Bermingham. D.D., V.G.  It is hoped it will be an attractive object on an island memorable for two wars.  The corner-stone of the church was laid under the title of "Saint Mary, Star of the Sea."
﻿A new frame church has been commenced under the exertion of Rt. Rev. Persico, D.D. It is already roofed.

﻿On the same lot with the Cathedral Chapel, a new parochial male school is just finished. It partly occupies the site where the residence of the priests stood before the fire. The bricks of the old ruins have been of material aid, and the brick building, large and spacious, is well adapted for its important object. Rev. Father Quigley took charge of this work, and has the credit of being successful. The upper story is a fine lengthy hall, constructed for the use of the members of the "Catholic Institute." The school is capable of accomodating four hundred pupils.
placeName: ﻿on the same lot with the Cathedral Chapel
